_exec_summary.SummaryText:
PRAIRIE AG COOP TAKES PRIDE IN OUR FACILITIES,  AND DO AS MUCH AS WE CAN TO ENSURE THAT  OUR FACILITIES ARE SANITARY AND SAFE.  ALL OF OUR AMMONIA FACILITIES ARE INSPECTEDAT LEAST TWICE A YEAR BY STATE INSPECTORS AS WELL AS THE LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENTS.  THEY ARE KEPT UP TO DATE WITH ALL THE LATEST SAFETY EQUIPMENT REQUIRED BY CODES , STANDARDS AND LAWS.  ALL OF OUR EMPLOYEES ARE REQUIRED BY PRAIRIE AG TO COMPLETE A SAFETY TRAINING COURSE PUT ON BY IOWA AGRI BUSINESS ASSOCIATION OF IOWA SPECIFICALLY FOR ANHYDROUS AMMONIA AS WELL AS OTHER AREAS OF THE BUSINESS. .                                                                          1, FACILITY INFORMATION:  THE PRIMARY ACTIVITY AT THIS LOCATION IS THE STORAGE AND SALE OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA AND FERTILIZERS..   THE MAXIMUM AMOUNT OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA STORED AT THIS FACILITY IN FOUR  STORAGE TANKS  267,800 POUNDS. THE MAXIMUM QUANTITY HANDLED WOULD BE THE UNLOADING OF A TANK TRUCK HOLDING 40,000 POUNDS.


 2. FACILITY POLICY:  THE MANAGEMENT, EMPLOYEES AND OWNERS ARE COMMITED TO THE PREVENTION OF ACCIDENTAL RELEASE OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA .  THIS FACILITY IS PREPARED TO WORK WITH THE LEPC AND LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENT  PERSONELL OR OTHER AUTHORITIES TO MITIGATE ANY RELEASE TO THE ENVIRONMENT OF OUR COMMUNITY. STAFF PRESENT DURING NORMAL WORKING HOURS.  DURING PERIODS OF NON OPERATION THIS FACILITY IS  PATROLED BY LOCAL LAW INFORCEMENT AT VARIOUS TIMES OF THE NIGHT , WHERE ANYTHING OUT OF THE ORDINARY IS REPORTED TO OUR 24 HOUR TELEPHONE NUMBERS POSTED IN MANY AREAS OF OUR FACILITY AND APPROPIATE ACTION IS TAKEN.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             3.  WORST CASE SCENERIO :  TOTAL RELEASE OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA FROM A STORAGE TANK  IS 227,630 POUNDS, THE

DISTANCE TO END POINT WOULD BE APROXIMATELY 3 MILES. WE FILL ALL OF OUR STORAGE AND NURSE TANKS TO 85%. .                                                                                                                                                                    4.  ALTERNATIVE CASE SCENARIO:  A RELEASE FROM A BREAK IN A TRANSFER HOSE.  THE DISTANCE TO END POINT WOULD BE APPROXIMATELY .4 MILES.  OUR FACILITY HAS EXCESS FLOW VALVES IN THE TANKS AND LINES, AS WELL AS BREAK AWAY COUPLERS AT THE RISERS AND EMERGENCY SHUT OFF VALVES. .                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        5.  FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY:  THERE HASE BEEN NO ACCIDENTAL RELEASES OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA IN THE PAST FIVE YEARS THAT HAS CAUSED PROPERTY DAMAGE TO THE FACILITY, INJURIES OR DEATH ON OR OFF SITE, EVACUATIONS OR ENVIRONMENTAL DAMAGES .                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        6.  EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM:  THE FACILITY HAS 1.  A WRITTEN EMERGENCY ACTION PLAN IN ACCORDANCE WITH OSHA STANDARDS, 29 CFR 1910.38. 2.  PROVIDES STATE AND LOCAL AUTHORITIES THE EMERGENCY PLANNING AND COMMUNITITY RIGHT TO KNOW INFORMATION., AS REQUIRED UNDER SARA TITLE 111 (EPCRA 3) COORDINATED WITH LOCAL EMERGENCY RESPONDERS. .

7.  ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM:  STORAGE TANKS AND NURSE TANKS ARE INSPECTED DAILEY TO ENSURE THAT VALVES ARE LOCKED AND HAVE NOT BEEN TAMPERED WITH, AND THAT ALL VALVES ARE TIGHTLY SHUT AND NOT LEAKING.  PERIODIC EVALUATIONS ARE ALSO PERFORMED TO ASSESS THE MAINTENANCE OF EQUIPMENT AND SAFE CONDITIONS AT THE FACILITY. .                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        8.   PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY:  SAFETY IMPROVEMENT IS AN ONGOING PROCESS AT THIS FACILITY.  PERIODIC EVALUATIONS ARE PERFORMED TO ASSESS THE MAINTAINANCE OF SAFE CONDITIONS.  THERE ARE NO ADDITIONAL SPECIFIC NH3 SAFETY RECOMMENDATIONS..
